description: From Dutch stom (“unfermented”, literally “mute; dull”). Compare French vin muet, German stummer Wein. Doublet of shtum.

examples: Let our wines, without mixture of stum, be all fine.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Wine revived by new fermentation, resulting from the admixture of must.

verbs.description: stum (third-person singular simple present stums, present participle stumming, simple past and past participle stummed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To renew (wine etc.) by mixing must with it and raising a new fermentation.
examples: We stum our crude wines  […] to renew their spirits.

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To fume, as a cask of liquor, with burning sulphur.
